slides.title: Number System
slides.content:
**Types of Numbers:**
- **Natural Numbers (N):** 1, 2, 3, 4, ...
- **Whole Numbers (W):** 0, 1, 2, 3, ...
- **Integers (Z):** ..., -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, ...
- **Rational Numbers (Q):** Can be written as p/q (e.g., 1/2, 3/4)
- **Irrational Numbers:** Cannot be written as fractions (e.g., √2, π)
- **Real Numbers (R):** All rational and irrational numbers

**Special Numbers:**
- **Even:** Divisible by 2 (2, 4, 6, 8, ...)
- **Odd:** Not divisible by 2 (1, 3, 5, 7, ...)
- **Prime:** Divisible only by 1 and itself (2, 3, 5, 7, 11, ...)
- **Composite:** Has more than 2 factors (4, 6, 8, 9, ...)

slides.title: Fractions & Decimals
slides.content:
**Fractions:**
- Proper Fraction: Numerator < Denominator (1/2, 3/4)
- Improper Fraction: Numerator ≥ Denominator (5/4, 7/3)
- Mixed Fraction: Whole number + Proper fraction (2¾ = 11/4)

**Operations:**
- Addition: Same denominator → add numerators (1/4 + 2/4 = 3/4)
- Different denominators → find LCM (1/2 + 1/3 = 3/6 + 2/6 = 5/6)

**Decimals:**
- 0.1 = 1/10 (one tenth)
- 0.5 = 1/2 (one half)
- 0.25 = 1/4 (one quarter)
- 0.75 = 3/4 (three quarters)

slides.title: Percentage & Ratio
slides.content:
**Percentage:**
- Meaning: Per hundred (x% = x/100)
- Finding percentage: (Part/Whole) × 100
- Example: 25% of 80 = (25/100) × 80 = 20

**Applications:**
- Profit% = (Profit/CP) × 100
- Loss% = (Loss/CP) × 100
- Discount% = (Discount/Marked Price) × 100

**Ratio & Proportion:**
- Ratio: Comparison of two quantities (a:b)
- Proportion: Equality of two ratios (a:b = c:d)
- Example: If 3:4 = 6:x, then x = 8

slides.title: Average, Time & Work
slides.content:
**Average:**
- Average = Sum of all values / Total number of values
- Example: Average of 10, 20, 30, 40 = (10+20+30+40)/4 = 25

**Time & Work:**
- Work = Rate × Time
- If A can do work in x days, A's 1 day work = 1/x
- Example: 5 workers complete job in 10 days
  Total work = 5 × 10 = 50 worker-days
  10 workers will take = 50/10 = 5 days

**Time, Speed & Distance:**
- Speed = Distance / Time
- Distance = Speed × Time
- Time = Distance / Speed
